snippet: Older voters rebelled when Medicare benefits were expanded at the cost of higher premiums, and some lawmakers who were involved see parallels today.
abstract: Congressional Memo; public uproar over the 1989 Medicare Catastrophic Coverage Act, intended to protect older Americans from bankruptcy due to medical bills, offers parallel to current turmoil of insurance exchanges under the Affordable Care Act; series of missteps caused law to be stricken from the books only seventeen months after it was signed by Pres Ronald Reagan, amounting to political catastrophe for lawmakers.
lead_paragraph: Older voters rebelled when Medicare benefits were expanded at the cost of higher premiums, and some lawmakers who were involved see parallels today.

headline.print_headline: Lesson Is Seen In Failed Law On Medicare
headline.main: Lesson Is Seen in Failure of Law on Medicare in 1989

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
